verses.roman:
tato gauhyaka-gāndharva-
paiśācoraga-rākṣasīḥ
prāyuṅkta śataśo daityaḥ
kārṣṇir vyadhamayat sa tāḥ

synonyms: tataḥ—then; gauhyaka-gāndharva-paiśāca-uraga-rākṣasīḥ—(weapons) of the Guhyakas, Gandharvas, witches, celestial serpents and Rākṣasas (man-eaters); prāyuṅkta—he used; śataśaḥ—hundreds; daityaḥ—the demon; kārṣṇiḥ—Lord Pradyumna; vyadhamayat—struck down; saḥ—He; tāḥ—these.
translation: The demon then unleashed hundreds of mystic weapons belonging to the Guhyakas, Gandharvas, Piśācas, Uragas and Rākṣasas, but Lord Kārṣṇi, Pradyumna, struck them all down.
